entries.label: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
Ministry of Fisheries,Animal Husbandry and Dairying
Ministry Of New and Renewable Energy
Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
Ministry of Women and Child Development
Ministry Of Skill Development And Entrepreneurship
Ministry Of Personnel, Public Grievances And Pensions
Ministry Of Petroleum and Natural Gas
Comptroller And Auditor General Of India
Ministry Of Environment,forests and climate change
Ministry Of Consumer Affairs, Food And Public Distribution
Ministry Of Development Of North Eastern Region
Ministry Of Statistics and Programme Implementation
NITI Aayog (National Institution for Transforming India)

fields.schemeName: Denture Grant (Sainik Welfare)
fields.briefDescription: "Denture Grant" is a scheme by the Armed Forces Flag Day Fund of the Dept of Sainik Welfare, Puducherry. ₹20,000/- is provided for the purchase of Denture to the registered ESM/Widows of ESM. The members of the Ex-Servicemen Contributory Health Scheme (ECHS) are not eligible.

fields.schemeName: Krishi Yantra
fields.briefDescription: In the Krishi Yantra scheme, the farmer purchases farming-related equipment from an authorized dealer, then the state government gives a subsidy to the farmers.

fields.schemeName: Naye Fal Bagicho Ki Sthapana
fields.briefDescription: Under the "Naye Fal Bagecho Ki Sthapana" subsidies to Increase farmers' income by facilitating the cultivation of high-value fruit crops that have a potentially higher market demand and profitability compared to traditional crops.

fields.schemeName: Plastic Mulching
fields.briefDescription: Under the Plastic Mulching scheme, the Rajasthan government provided subsidies to farmers. In this, the soil surface of the field is covered with plastic film. Farmer can also use crop residues for laying mulch.

fields.schemeName: Walk In Tunnel
fields.briefDescription: Under the Walk-In Tunnel, the Rajasthan government provides the benefit of a subsidy to the farmers with affordable and efficient structures that offer protection from adverse weather conditions, pests, and diseases.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Niramaya Health Insurance Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Niramaya Health Insurance Scheme ,launched by the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities, aims to provide affordable health insurance to the Persons with Disabilities (PwDs).

fields.schemeName: Dr. P. G. Solanki Scheme for Loan/Assistance to Law Graduates of Scheduled Caste
fields.briefDescription: The scheme was launched in year 1973. Under this scheme, law graduates belonging to the Scheduled Caste who intend to start independent legal practice will receive financial assistance for the purchase of business premises/shops.

fields.schemeName: Scholarship/Stipend to SC Students for ITI/Professional Courses (Swami Vivekanand Scholarship)
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, a monthly stipend/scholarship will be given to Scheduled Caste Category students who are studying professional courses in Government or Private Industrial Training Institute (ITI).

fields.schemeName: Coaching Assistance Scheme for Preparation of Recruitment Exams for Scheduled Caste Students
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance to Students of SC category who are preparing for all State Government and Central Government Recruitment Examinations of Class– 1, 2 & 3 conducted by UPSC/GPSC/State Commission/Bank/LIC/Subordinate Services Selection Board/District Panchayat Selection Board.

fields.schemeName: Kunwar Bai Nu Mameru Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme was initiated in 1991. Under the scheme, financial assistance is provided on the occasion of the marriage of two adult girls belonging to the Scheduled Caste category.

fields.schemeName: Shravan Kumar Shramik Parivar Tirth Yatra Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The Shravan Kumar Shramik Parivar Tirth Yatra Yojana (SKSPTYY) is a scheme launched by the Uttar Pradesh government in 2022 to provide financial assistance to the families of construction workers for undertaking pilgrimage.

fields.schemeName: Dattopant Thengadi Mratak Shramik Aarthik Sahayata Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The Government of Uttar Pradesh initiated a scheme "Dattopant Thengadee Mrtak Shramik Aarthik Sahaayata Yojana" to the families of deceased workers.

fields.schemeName: Mai Ramabai Ambedakar Saat Phera Samuh Lagna Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, incentives are provided to couples who participate in group marriages, as well as to the organizing institution. If people adopt the practice of group marriages, they can avoid the unnecessary expenses associated with individual weddings and promote financial growth.

fields.schemeName: Young Innovators Program
fields.briefDescription: The Young Innovators Program by Mission Youth, J&K aims to ignite a fire of innovation among the youth of Jammu and Kashmir.  It goes beyond just encouraging creative ideas; it actively empowers them to bring those ideas to life.

fields.schemeName: Disability Pension (GBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Through the "Disability Pension" scheme, the worker who is permanently disabled due to Paralysis / Leprosy / Tuberculosis(TB) / Accident is provided with financial assistance of ₹300/- per month, and an ex-gratia payment of not more than ₹10,000/-, depending on the percentage of the disability.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Award of Scholarships to School or College-Going Children of Employees/Industrial Employees in Various Establishments
fields.briefDescription: "Scheme for Award of Scholarships to School or College-Going Children of Employees/Industrial Employees in Various Establishments" by the Dept of Labour and Employment, Goa provides financial assistance to the children of industry workers to support their educational pursuits.

fields.schemeName: Assistance for Power Driven Chaff Cutter Scheme under Tribal Area Sub Plan (TASP- ST Category)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance to dairy farmers belonging to ST category on purchase of electric powered chaff cutters. By using power driven chaff cutter, dairy farmers can reduce wastage of green & dry fodder which is economically important for their profitable dairy farming.

fields.schemeName: Utility Based Handicrafts Award
fields.briefDescription: The "Utility Based Handicrafts Award" scheme was launched by the Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles, and Khadi Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to encourage artisans to produce utility based handicrafts. This award will be given to 3 artisans. This award consists of a cash prize..

fields.schemeName: Poompuhar State Award
fields.briefDescription: "Poompuhar State Award" was launched by the Dept of Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles & Khadi, Tamil Nadu. The awardees are given ₹50,000, a 4-gram gold medal, tamirapathiram and a certificate. The economically backward awardees are also eligible for monthly pension of ₹3,500/- after 60 years of age.

fields.schemeName: The Meghalaya Tribal Students’ Book Grant (Post-Matric Education)
fields.briefDescription: "The Meghalaya Tribal Students’ Book Grant (Post-Matric Education)" scheme was launched by the Directorate of Higher and Technical Education, Meghalaya. Through this scheme, financial assistance is provided to the meritorious tribal students for the purchase of books for their studies.

fields.schemeName: Pichda Varg Post Matric Chhatravritti
fields.briefDescription: Under Pichda Varg Post Matric Chhatravritti Madhya Pradesh Government aimed at providing financial assistance to economically disadvantaged students belonging to these marginalized communities.

fields.schemeName: Post Metric Scholarship - Madhya Pradesh
fields.briefDescription: Under the Post-Matric Scholarship is a Madhya Pradesh Government initiative to provide financial assistance to economically weaker social class students to pursue higher education after matriculation.

fields.schemeName: Pension To Widows And Destitute Women-Chandigarh
fields.briefDescription: Under the Pension To Widows And Destitute Women scheme To provide financial assistance to Widows and Destitute Women of Chandigarh.

fields.schemeName: Assistance for Tools, Equipment, Shorting/Grading Equipment, PHM Equipment for General Category (HRT-2)
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, financial assistance is provided to farmers belonging to the General Category as well as to farmer groups and cooperative societies for purchasing various tools, equipment, sorting/grading equipment, and Post-Harvest Management (PHM) equipment.

fields.schemeName: Assistance for Tools, Equipment, Shorting/Grading Equipment, PHM Equipment for Scheduled Tribes (HRT-3)
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, financial assistance is provided to farmers belonging to the Scheduled Tribes category as well as to farmer groups and cooperative societies for purchasing various tools, equipment, sorting/grading equipment, and Post-Harvest Management (PHM) equipment.

fields.schemeName: Coaching Assistance to Scheduled Castes Students for Preparation of Examination Like IIM, NIFT, NLU, CEPT
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, financial assistance is provided to Students of the Scheduled Castes category who are preparing for examinations like IIM, NIFT, NLU, and CEPT.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Meet the Funeral Expenses of Differently Abled Person
fields.briefDescription: The scheme 'Financial Assistance to Meet the Funeral Expenses of Differently Abled Person' was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons. In this scheme, financial assistance of ₹2,000/- is provided to meet the expenses in connection with funeral, in the event of the...

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance on the Natural Death of Differently Abled Person
fields.briefDescription: "Financial Assistance on the Natural Death of Differently Abled Person" was launched by the Dept for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Tamil Nadu. A financial assistance of ₹15,000/- is provided to the legal heir in the event of the natural death of the differently-abled person.

fields.schemeName: AGR-50 Scheme-Assistance To Purchase Tractors
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “AGR-50 Scheme-Assistance to Purchase Tractors” was started by the Department of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare & Co-operation, Government of Gujarat in the year 2011-12. The scheme was implemented for the farmers to help in buying the tractor in the state.

fields.schemeName: Maintenance Allowance for Leprosy Affected Persons
fields.briefDescription: The 'Maintenance Allowance for Leprosy Affected Persons' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide a maintenance allowance to leprosy-affected persons.

fields.schemeName: Umbrella Assistance Scheme (UKBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, an umbrella will be provided free of cost to registered building & construction workers to protect them from rain and sun. No financial assistance will be paid to the beneficiary, and the benefit will be given only once in their lifetime.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Assistance to Normal Persons Marrying Visually Impaired Persons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme 'Marriage Assistance to Normal Persons Marrying Visually Impaired Persons' was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Govt. of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide marriage assistance to a normal person marrying a visually Impaired Person.

fields.schemeName: Modular Reflective Folding Sticks (Smartcane)
fields.briefDescription: The 'Modular Reflective Folding Sticks (Smartcane)' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons Govt. of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to distribute modular reflective folding sticks to needy visually impaired persons for self-orientation & independent mobility.

fields.schemeName: Bicycle/Sewing Machine Assistance Scheme (UKBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, bicycles are provided to registered building & construction workers in plain areas, while sewing machines are provided to registered workers or their dependents in mountainous/hilly areas. These benefits are granted only once in a lifetime.

fields.schemeName: Andaman & Nicobar Bed & Breakfast / Home Stay Establishment Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The Directorate of Tourism, Andaman & Nicobar Administration is implementing ‘Andaman & Nicobar Bed & Breakfast/Homestay Scheme’ all over the Island based on the approved guidelines of the Ministry of Tourism, Govt. of India under the scheme “Incredible India Bed & Breakfast/Homestay Establishment”.

fields.schemeName: Scheme For Subsidy On Interest For Establishment Of 1 To 20 Milch Animal Farm For Scheduled Tribe
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Scheme for Subsidy on Interest for Establishment of 1 to 20 Milch Animal Farm for Scheduled Tribe” was started by the Dept. of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare & Co-operation, Govt. of Gujarat.

fields.schemeName: Scheme of Personal Assistance Allowance to Differently Abled Persons with High Support Need
fields.briefDescription: The "Scheme of Personal Assistance Allowance to Differently Abled Persons with High Support Need" was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Govt. of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide a personal assistance allowance of ₹1,000 to differently abled person.

fields.schemeName: Assistance to Law Graduates
fields.briefDescription: The "Assistance to Law Graduates" scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹50,000 will be given to the differently abled Law graduates for enrolment in the Bar Council as lawyer.

fields.schemeName: Award of Scholarship to the Cadets Belonging to UT of Puducherry and Studying in Rashtriya Indian Military College, Dehradun
fields.briefDescription: The objective of this scheme is to extend scholarships worth of ₹20,000/- per annum to the cadets belonging to the Union Territory of Puducherry who come from economically weak backgrounds and have been selected for admission into the Rashtriya Indian Military College, Dehradun.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Women and Child Development
fields.schemeName: Internship Programme for Women Students / Scholars / Social Activists / Teachers
fields.briefDescription: The Ministry of Women and Child Development launched the Internship Programme aims to harness the talent of the trainees, giving them an opportunity to work towards bringing more efficiency in the implementation of the schemes.

fields.schemeName: Disability Assistance For Registered Worker (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Disability Assistance for Registered Worker (HBOCWWB)” was launched by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana.

fields.schemeName: Scholarship (Above VIII Standard) - Tamil Nadu
fields.briefDescription: The 'Scholarship (Above VIII Standard) by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide scholarships to differently-abled students studying in government school/colleges/training centre

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for Treatment of Chronic Diseases (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹1,00,000/- is provided to registered workers for indoor treatment of chronic diseases like Cancer, TB, AIDS, etc. as per government rules.

fields.schemeName: Free Travelling Facility (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, the amount spent by registered workers and 4 family members for visiting famous religious/historical places once in four years will be paid at the rates prescribed by Haryana Roadways (ordinary fare) or actual railway fare (Second Class).

fields.schemeName: Scholarship (I to VIII Standard) by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The 'Scholarship (I to VIII Standard) by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide scholarships to purchase notebooks for differently-abled students studying in government school.

fields.schemeName: Widow Pension-West Bengal
fields.briefDescription: The West Bengal government's Women and Child Development and Social Welfare Department launched the "Widow Pension" scheme in 2010. This program aims to support widows facing economic hardship within the state.

fields.schemeName: Banglashree for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises: Subsidy on Stamp Duty and Registration Fee (SDRFS)
fields.briefDescription: “Subsidy on Stamp Duty and Registration Fee (SDRFS)” incentives under “Banglashree for MSMEs” scheme implemented by the MSMEs Dept., Government of West Bengal, provides a reimbursement of stamp duty and registration fee paid by the eligible enterprises for the purpose of registration of documents.

fields.schemeName: Mukhya Mantri Shramyogi Prathibhavan Vidyarthi Yojana (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board provides financial assistance for books, stationery, hostels, and laptops/computers for higher education to the meritorious children of registered construction workers.

fields.schemeName: Special Education - Tamil Nadu
fields.briefDescription: The scheme 'Special Education by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons' was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide free special education, & vocational training to the visually impaired, hearing-impaired person.

fields.schemeName: One Time Assistance to Small and Marginal Farmers for Purchase of Small Farm Implements (OTA-SFI)
fields.briefDescription: “One Time Assistance to Small and Marginal Farmers for Purchase of Small Farm Implements (OTA-SFI)”  by the Agriculture Department, Government of West Bengal aims to aid the farmers in procuring manually operated small farm implements necessary for agricultural operations.

fields.schemeName: Retrofitted Petrol Scooters - Tamil Nadu
fields.briefDescription: The 'Retrofitted Petrol Scooters by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons Department' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Govt. of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide a retrofitted petrol scooter to orthopedically differently-abled persons.

fields.schemeName: West Bengal Migrant Workers’ Welfare Scheme: Repatriation of Dead Body
fields.briefDescription: "West Bengal Migrant Workers’ Welfare Scheme: Repatriation of Dead Body" is a social welfare scheme implemented by the West Bengal Migrant Workers’ Welfare Board, that provides an one time assistance to the nominee for bringing the dead body of the registered migrant worker in case of death.

fields.schemeName: Calipers and Crutches - Tamil Nadu
fields.briefDescription: The 'Calipers and Crutches by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons' scheme was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Tamil Nadu. In this scheme, calipers & crutches are given to the needy & deserving orthopedically differently-abled persons for their easy mobility.

fields.schemeName: Tricycles - Tamil Nadu
fields.briefDescription: The Department launched the 'Tricycles by Welfare of Differently Abled Persons' scheme for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Govt. of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to distribute tricycles to deserving orthopedically differently abled persons affected by both lower limbs for their easy mobility

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Workers with a Visually, Physically or Mentally Disabled Child- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to the disabled (blind, mentally retarded, mute and deaf) children of registered workers employed in industrial and commercial establishments in the state of Haryana.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for Working Women Workers or Wives of Male Workers for Maternity- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹10,000/- is provided to female workers and wives of male workers working in industrial and commercial establishments in the state of Haryana for the delivery of up to two children (three girls or two boys).

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for Artificial Limbs to Workers and their Dependents- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided for artificial limbs upto rates fixed by Saket Hospital, Chandimandir(Panchkula). This assistance is available to workers employed in industrial &commercial units in Haryana and their dependents, who become disabled due to the loss of vital organs.

fields.schemeName: Early Intervention Centres for Children with Autism
fields.briefDescription: The "Early Intervention Centres for Children with Autism" was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. Under this scheme, Early intervention programme emphasizes attending to social stimuli, imitation skills, language comprehension and usage.

fields.schemeName: Dental Care Scheme- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: Under this Scheme, workers & their dependents are entitled to receive financial assistance of upto ₹4,000/- or the actual expenditure, whichever is less, for dental care. Furthermore, assistance of upto ₹10,000/- or the actual expenditure, whichever is less, is provided for fixation of full denture.

fields.schemeName: Minimata Mahtari Jatan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The Labor Department of Chhattisgarh started this scheme on March 4, 2010, under the "Building and Construction Workers Welfare Board" for female construction workers. Under the scheme registered female construction workers will receive benefits during pregnancy.

fields.schemeName: Leave Travel Concession Scheme- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, an amount of ₹1,500/- is provided to the workers employed in the industrial and commercial institutions of the state of Haryana in the form of Leave Travel Concession (LTC) for travel once in a block of 4 years.

fields.schemeName: Old Age Pension
fields.briefDescription: In 2010, the Women and Child Development and Social Welfare Department of the West Bengal State Government introduced the "Old Age Pension" scheme.

fields.schemeName: Sewing Machine Scheme- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹4,500/- is provided to women workers employed in Industrial and Commercial Establishments in the state of Haryana for the purchase of sewing machines for their domestic use.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for Professional/Technical Courses (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: This scheme is implemented by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department Haryana. Under this scheme, the full educational expenses of the children of registered workers in professional/technical courses are reimbursed by the Board.

fields.schemeName: West Bengal Textile Incentive Scheme: Waiver of Electricity Duty
fields.briefDescription: “Waiver of Electricity Duty” incentives under “West Bengal Textile Incentive Scheme” scheme implemented by the Dept. of MSME&T, Government of West Bengal,  aims to provide waiver of electricity duty on the electricity consumed in its approved project.

fields.schemeName: Bicycle Scheme- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹5,000/- is provided to the workers employed in the industrial and commercial establishments of the state of Haryana for the purchase of a new bicycle for commuting on duty from their residence to the establishments.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Indigent Tamil Scholars
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Financial Assistance to Indigent Tamil Scholars" was launched by the Arts & Culture Department, Puducherry. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance of ₹1,500 per month to indigent artists aged 58 years & above & contribution to Tamil language & literature must be of significance.

fields.schemeName: Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme - II
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme - II" was launched by the Social Welfare and Nutritious Meal Programme Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to assist poor parents in getting their daughters married & to promote education status.

fields.schemeName: Free Supply of Note Books to the Children of Poor Widows
fields.briefDescription: The Social Welfare and Nutritious Meal Programme Department, Government of Tamil Nadu launched the "Free Supply of Note Books to the Children of Poor Widows" scheme to supply notebooks to children of poor widows studying up to higher secondary courses and govt. children homes and service homes.

fields.schemeName: Supporting Community Radio Movement in India
fields.briefDescription: The GOI has a policy for grant of License to eligible organisations for setting up of Community Radio Stations. To support the Sector, the Scheme provides financial assistance once the Community Radio is made operational by eligible organisation. The Scheme also has components for capacity building.

fields.schemeName: Incentive Scheme for MSMEs in Powerloom Sector: Subsidy for State Goods and Services Tax (SGST)
fields.briefDescription: “Subsidy for State Goods and Services Tax (SGST)” incentive under the “Incentive Scheme for MSMEs in Powerloom Sector” scheme implemented by the Dept. of MSME & T, Government of West Bengal, aims to provide refund of Net SGST paid to the Government of West Bengal for its approved project.

fields.schemeName: Incentive Scheme for MSMEs in Powerloom Sector: Waiver of Electricity Duty
fields.briefDescription: “Waiver of Electricity Duty” incentives under the “Incentive Scheme for MSMEs in Powerloom Sector” scheme implemented by the Dept. of MSME & T, Government of West Bengal, aims to provide reimbursement of electricity duty on the electricity consumed for the manufacturing activity.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Providing Employment Opportunities by Establishing Piggery, Sheep and Goat Units (General)
fields.briefDescription: This scheme is a credit linked scheme with a primary objective of providing self-employment opportunities, the unemployed persons will be assisted by way of establishing Sheep or Goat Units (15 female+1 male) and Piggery Unit (10 female+1 male).

fields.schemeName: Funeral Assistance- Haryana Silicosis Board
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹15,000/- is given to the dependent/nominee of a deceased worker, who was confirmed to have Silicosis by the Silicosis Diagnosis Board, Haryana, for performing the funerary rituals.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Kanya Vivah Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The purpose of this scheme is to provide financial assistance to poor families at the time of marriage, To encourage, encourage girl education and prevent child marriage.

fields.schemeName: Merit Cum Means Based Scholarship For Students Belonging To The Minority Communities
fields.briefDescription: A scholarship scheme by the Ministry of Minority Affairs for students from minority communities pursuing technical and professional courses at undergraduate and postgraduate levels in a listed institute. A total of 60,000 scholarships are targeted to be distributed as ‘Fresh’ Scholarships.

fields.schemeName: Subsidy for Disabled Young Professionals
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, loans up to ₹25,00,000/- are provided to professionally educated unemployed disabled youth who fall under the OH, VH, HH, or MR categories, at different interest rates ranging from 4.5% to 8% per annum.

fields.schemeName: Subsidy for Developing Business Premises for Persons with Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: The scheme is implemented by the Haryana Backward Classes & Economically Weaker Sections Kalyan Nigam. Under this scheme, loans up to ₹3 lakh are provided to persons with disabilities to develop business premises on their own land & start self-employment activities.

fields.schemeName: Micro Finance Scheme- Credit Line 1 for Minority Community
fields.briefDescription: The scheme is implemented by the Haryana Backward Classes and Economically Weaker Sections Kalyan Nigam. Under the scheme, small loans of ₹1,00,000/- are provided to members of SHGs, either directly or through the SHGs, to meet the needs of the poorest among the poor.

fields.schemeName: Old Age Samman Allowance
fields.briefDescription: "Old Age Samman Allowance" is a social security scheme implemented by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of Haryana. The scheme provides a pension of ₹ 3000/month to senior citizens (60 years of age or older) who are unable to sustain themselves with their own resource

fields.schemeName: Vice Chancellor Internship Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The Vice Chancellor Internship Scheme (VCIS) by the University of Delhi aims to provide students with experiential learning opportunities, integrating academic knowledge with practical work experience. This initiative aligns with the objectives of "Samagra Shiksha" (holistic education) as outlined..

fields.schemeName: Shilp Sampada Term Loan Scheme for Backward Classes- Haryana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides loans of up to ₹10,00,000/- to artisans & handicraft persons from backward classes to preserve traditional arts and crafts. The scheme also offers training to upgrade their existing skills with the latest technological inputs, such as the use of computers, CAD, etc.

fields.schemeName: Micro Credit Finance under NSKFDC- Haryana
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, loan is provided to Safai Karamchari and their dependents for projects with a maximum cost up to ₹1,00,000/- per beneficiaries for small and petty trade/business and various income generating activities.

fields.schemeName: Mahila Adhikarita Yojana under NSKFDC- Haryana
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, loan is provided to woman Safai Karamchari and their dependent daughters for projects with a maximum project cost of up to ₹2,00,000/- for small and petty trade/businesses, and various income-generating activities such as beauty parlors, boutiques, cosmetic shop, bangle shop, etc.

fields.schemeName: Permanent Disability/ Death Benefit for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Permanent Disability/ Death Benefit for the Construction Workers" by the Sikkim BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, is a welfare scheme of the board that provides financial assistance is provided to the nominees/ dependents of a member, in case of his/her death or Permanent Disability.

fields.schemeName: National Centre for Earth Science Studies Internship Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The “National Centre for Earth Science Studies Internship” scheme by the Earth System Science Organization, Ministry of Earth Sciences, provides various opportunities for school as well as college students to familiarise and/or pursue research on different branches of earth sciences.

fields.schemeName: Piggery Farming Scheme (HSFDC)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, the Corporation provides loans/benefits to individuals from Below Poverty Line (BPL) families, whose annual family income does not exceed ₹1,80,000/-, in both rural and urban areas for self-employment income-generating activities such as piggery farming.

fields.schemeName: The West Bengal Incentive Scheme: Additional Incentive for Adventure Tour Operators
fields.briefDescription: “Additional Incentive for Adventure Tour Operators” incentives under the “WBIS” scheme by the Dept. of Tourism, Government of West Bengal, aims to provide reimbursement incentives with SGST payments for purchasing tents, dinghies, adventure & sports equipment, and related accessories.

fields.schemeName: Kashyapa Scheme for Food & Shelter
fields.briefDescription: The "Kashyapa Scheme for Food & Shelter" aims to help poor, orphan children, differently-abled individuals, widows, destitute women separated from their husbands, and elderly Brahmins with financial assistance for meeting their food and shelter expenses. This scheme covers 13 districts of the state.

fields.schemeName: Veda Vyasa Scheme for Vedic Education
fields.briefDescription: Andhra Pradesh Brahmin Welfare Corporation launched the “Veda Vyasa Scheme for Vedic Education” for the year 2019-20, to encourage Vedic Education in Andhra Pradesh.  Under this scheme, selected applicants will be granted Annual Financial Assistance.

fields.schemeName: Gayathri Scheme for Academic Excellence
fields.briefDescription: The "Gayathri Scheme for Academic Excellence" scheme aims to provide awards to the topper of the recognized and reputed School/ College/ Institute for his/her academic excellence in SSC/ Intermediate or equivalent/ Graduation/ Professional Education Course for the Academic year.

fields.schemeName: Lakshmir Bhandar Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Lakshmir Bhandar" scheme is a flagship program to provide financial assistance to women from economically weaker sections of society, for the empowerment of women in the age group of 25-60 years, and enrolled in ‘Swasthya Sathi’.

fields.schemeName: Post Matric Scholarship Scheme For The Students Belonging To Scheduled Tribe For Studies In India
fields.briefDescription: This is a centrally sponsored scheme by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs, for the students of Scheduled Tribe (ST) for studies in India. This scheme is for pursuing higher education starting from class XI to Post Graduation courses in India.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to WW II Veteran and Widows of WW II Veterans
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, financial assistance of ₹10,000/- per month shall be given to Ex-servicemen of the Pre-Independence Era (World War II Veterans) & their widows, who are not in receipt of any kind of pension/financial assistance either from any Department of Government of India/State Government.

fields.schemeName: Skill Development Allowance Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The Department of Labour & Employment, Government of Himachal Pradesh introduced a scheme of granting Skill Development Allowance to the unemployed youth aims at providing allowance to educated unemployed persons for their Skill upgradation.

fields.schemeName: Bharati Scheme for Education - 1st Class to 5th Class
fields.briefDescription: "The Bharati Scheme for Education - 1st Class to 5th Class" encourages Brahmin students of Andhra Pradesh to continue their education.  Under this scheme, financial assistance for the academic year will be granted to eligible poor Brahmin student applicants.

fields.schemeName: Unemployment Allowance Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The Department of Labour and Employment, Government of Himachal Pradesh introduced Unemployment Allowance Scheme to provide allowance to eligible educated unemployed youth of Himachal, to enable them to sustain themselves for a certain period.

fields.schemeName: Chief Minister Higher Education Encouragement Scholarship Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, scholarships are provided to encourage meritorious students pursuing graduation or post-graduation in government colleges. The scheme started with the distribution of scholarships to students enrolled in the 2023-24 academic session.

fields.schemeName: Sudama Pre-Matric Scholarship Scheme (Class 9th to 10th)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, scholarships are provided to students studying in Class 9 and Class 10 in government schools, whose annual family income is less than ₹1,00,000/- and who belong to the Below Poverty Line (BPL) category.

fields.schemeName: Maintenance Of Pregnant Desi Indigenous Cows Ration For BPL Families
fields.briefDescription: The Department of Animal Husbandry, Government of Himachal Pradesh had introduced a scheme with the help of which balanced ration at the rate 3kg/day/cow or buffalo for maximum of two animals for three months during the last trimester of pregnancy at 50% subsidy.
